desc: Daniel Morgan was a private investigator who was murdered in 1987. Shortly before his death, he had told several people that he was about to sell a story to a newspaper about large scale police corruption.
Jonathan Rees was a private investigator and business partner of Daniel Morgan.
Sid Fillery is a former police detective.
Glenn Vian is a career criminal.
Garry Vian is a career criminal.
Dean Vian is a former Metropolitcan police officer.
Dave Cook is a former Detective Chief Superintendent, who ran the 4th and 5th investigations into Daniel Morgan's murder.
The Golden Lion is a pub in Sydenham, London, where Daniel Morgan was murdered in the carpark in 1987.
Southern Investigations was a private investigation agency founded by Daniel Morgan and Jonathan Rees.
News of the World was a weekly tabloid that was shut down in 2011 due to revelations of its involvement in the phone hacking scandal.
Margaret Harrison is the wife of Jonathan Rees.
Rupert Murdoch is a media mogul who owns hundreds of local, national, and international media outlets across the world.
Rebekah Brooks is a media executive and protégé of Rupert Murdoch.
Alex Marunchak was the crime editor of the News of the World.
Jill Dando was a journalist and TV presenter who was murdered outside her own home in 1999.
Jacqui Hames is a journalist and TV presenter.
Crimewatch was a TV programme that reconstructed major unsolved crimes to gain information from the public.
Alan "Taffy" Holmes was a detective who apparently committed suicide in 1987, just a few months after the murder of Daniel Morgan.
Derek Haslam is a former Metropolitan police officer who later worked as an undercover agent.
